1.segment: Human T lymphotropic virus type 1 ( HTLV-1 ) is a retrovirus that causes lifelong T-cell infection in humans ,

3.segment: This virus causes a range of clinical manifestations ,

4.segment: from inflammatory conditions , including neuronal damage ( HTLV-1 associated myelopathy , HAM ) to life-threatening leukemia ( adult T-cell leukemia , ATL ) .

5.segment: Human T lymphotropic virus type 1 is also associated with increased risk of all-cause mortality ,

7.segment: As a blood-borne and sexually transmitted infection ( STI ) ,

8.segment: HTLV-1 shares transmission routes to many other pathogens and although it has worldwide distribution ,

9.segment: it affects mainly those in low - and middle-income tropical areas ,

10.segment: where the prevalence of other infectious agents is high .

11.segment: These factors contribute to a high incidence of co-infections in people living with HTLV-1 ( PLHTLV ) .

12.segment: This comprehensive review addresses the impact of HTLV-1 on several co-infections and vice-versa .

13.segment: There is evidence of higher rates of HTLV-1 infection in association with other blood borne ( HCV , HBV ) and sexually transmitted ( Syphilis , Chlamydia , HPV , HSV ) infections but whether this represents increased susceptibility or opportunity is unclear .

14.segment: Higher frequency of Mycobacterium tuberculosis ( MTb ) and Mycobacterium leprae ( M. leprae ) is observed in PLHTLV .

15.segment: Reports of opportunistic infections and high frequency of crusted scabies in patients with HTLV-1 points to immune impairment in those individuals .

16.segment: Human T lymphotropic virus type 1 may influence the persistence of pathogens ,

17.segment: exemplified by the higher rates of Schistosoma mansoni and Strongyloides stercoralis ( St. stercoralis ) treatment failure observed in PLHTLV .

18.segment: This retrovirus is also associated with increased tuberculosis ( TB ) severity with some evidence pointing to a deleterious impact on leprosy outcome as well .

19.segment: These findings are supported by immune alterations observed in those co-infected individuals .

20.segment: Although the role of HTLV-1 in HCV outcome is debatable ,

21.segment: most data indicate that HTLV may negatively impact the clinical course of hepatitis C. Co-infections may also influence the risk of developing HTLV-1 associated disease ,

23.segment: The impact of HTLV-1 on the response to more common infections ,

24.segment: might contribute to the increased mortality rate of HTLV-1 .

25.segment: Large scale prospective controlled studies on the prevalence and impact of HTLV-1 in co-infections and vice-versa are needed .

26.segment: Human T lymphotropic virus type 1 impact in public health is broad .

27.segment: Measures to increase awareness and to prevent new infections are needed .
